page.title: 16Made in Haverfordwest
page.content: Norman Industries is a busy, thriving light industry. It was established in Snowdrop Lane in 1976. They make furniture: wardrobes,bedside lockers,chairs,computer trolleys,beds bookstands and stereo units. The Norman Industries computer trolley has been especially designed for use in Dyfed schools. Their abacus is designed to encourage early counting and numeracy as a traditional teaching aid for early learning. The factory,administered by the local authority's Social Services Department,can provide employment for 30-40 disabled persons. Unigate have a cheese factory in Merlin's Bridge which makes three different types of cheese,cheddar,red leicester & double Gloucester. Unigate bought the factory from Kraft Foods in 1984. The factory employs 165 people.
